Matthew Lavallee

              Matthew Lavallee

            About
            I am PhD student at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of
            Public Health, training to become a health economist. My
            research interests include Medicaid, the social safety net,
            and how programs interact. Before graduate school, I worked
            as a Tobin Center / Economics Pre-Doctoral Fellow
            researching access to care and quality of care in Medicaid,
            and how social programs shape care for Medicaid
            enrollees.
            
            
            Education
                  Hampshire College - Amherst, Massachusetts
                        BA in Economics &
            Mathematics
                  Johns Hopkins University - Baltimore, Maryland
                        PhD in Health Economics &
            Policy
